age, gender, race, and renal and hepatic function were included as factors assessed in the population pharmacokinetic model to evaluate sildenafil pharmacokinetics in patients with pah.
due to age-differences in plasma protein binding, the corresponding increase in the auc of free (unbound) sildenafil and its active n-desmethyl metabolite were 45% and 57%, respectively.
in volunteers with mild (clcr = 50 to 80 ml/min) and moderate (clcr = 30 to 49 ml/min) renal impairment, the pharmacokinetics of a single oral dose of sildenafil (50 mg) was not altered.
in volunteers with severe (clcr less than 30 ml/min) renal impairment, sildenafil clearance was reduced, resulting in approximately doubling of auc and cmax compared to age-matched volunteers with no renal impairment.

in one of two perinatal/postnatal developmental studies in rats, postnatal pup survival decreased following maternal exposure to unbound tadalafil concentrations greater than 5 times the mrhd based on auc.
inhibition of pde5 by tadalafil increases the concentrations of cgmp resulting in relaxation of pulmonary vascular smooth muscle cells and vasodilation of the pulmonary vascular bed.
following dosing, the mean reduction in supine systolic/diastolic blood pressure because of tadalafil 10 mg in subjects taking bendroflumethiazide was 6/4 mm hg, compared to placebo.
in subjects receiving concomitant tadalafil (20 mg single dose) and doxazosin (8 mg daily), an alpha-1 adrenergic receptor blocker, there was an augmentation of the blood pressure&ndash;lowering effect of doxazosin.
in addition there was no adverse effect on mean concentrations of reproductive hormones, testosterone, luteinizing hormone or follicle stimulating hormone with either 10 or 20 mg of tadalafil compared to placebo.
during tadalafil 20 and 40 mg once daily dosing, steady-state plasma concentrations were attained within 5 days, and exposure was approximately 1.3-fold higher than after a single dose.
absorption &mdash; after single oral-dose administration, the maximum observed plasma concentration (c max) of tadalafil is achieved between 2 and 8 hours (median time of 4 hours).
hemodialysis (performed between 24 and 30 hours post-dose) contributed negligibly to tadalafil or metabolite elimination [see dosage and administration (2.2) and warnings and precautions (5.3)].
patients with diabetes mellitusin male patients with diabetes mellitus after a 10 mg tadalafil dose, exposure (auc) was reduced approximately 19% and c max was 5% lower than that observed in healthy subjects.
p-glycoprotein (e.g., digoxin) &mdash; coadministration of tadalafil (40 mg once per day) for 10 days did not have a significant effect on the steady-state pharmacokinetics of digoxin (0.25 mg/day) in healthy subjects.
combined oral contraceptives &mdash; at steady-state, tadalafil (40 mg once per day) increased ethinyl estradiol exposure (auc) by 26% and c max by 70% relative to oral contraceptive administered with placebo.
systemic exposure (based on auc) at no&ndash;observed&ndash;adverse-effect&ndash;level (noael) (10 mg/kg/day) for unbound tadalafil was similar to that expected in humans at the mrhd of 40 mg.
in mice and rats, lymphoid necrosis and hemorrhage were seen in the spleen, thymus, and mesenteric lymph nodes at unbound tadalafil exposure of 1&ndash; to 17&ndash;fold the human exposure (aucs) at the mrhd of 40 mg.
in dogs, an increased incidence of disseminated arteritis was observed in 1&ndash; and 6-month studies at unbound tadalafil exposure of 0.5&ndash; to 38&ndash;fold the human exposure (auc) at the mrhd of 40 mg.
in addition, there was no evidence of teratogenicity, embryotoxicity, or fetotoxicity when tadalafil was given to pregnant rats or mice at exposures up to 7 times the mrhd during the period of major organ development.

a postmarketing study evaluating the effect of combining vardenafil with another drug of comparable qt effect showed an additive qt effect when compared with either drug alone [see clinical pharmacology (12.2)].
these observations should be considered in clinical decisions when prescribing vardenafil to patients with known history of qt prolongation or patients who are taking medications known to prolong the qt interval.
in the placebo-controlled clinical trials for vardenafil film-coated tablets and staxyn, the discontinuation rate due to adverse events was 1.9% for vardenafil compared to 0.8% for placebo.

the interaction is a consequence of blocking hepatic metabolism of vardenafil by ritonavir, a hiv protease inhibitor and a highly potent cyp3a4 inhibitor, which also inhibits cyp2c9.

vardenafil hydrochloride orally disintegrating tablets provide higher systemic exposure compared to vardenafil 10 mg film-coated tablets (levitra)[see clinical pharmacology (12.3).].
renal impairment: do not use vardenafil hydrochloride orally disintegrating tablets in patients on renal dialysis [see warnings and precautions (5.9) and clinical pharmacology (12.3)].concomitant medications.
administration of vardenafil hydrochloride orally disintegrating tablets with nitrates (either regularly and/or intermittently) and nitric oxide donors is contraindicated [see clinical pharmacology (12.2)].
therefore, pde5 inhibitors, including vardenafil hydrochloride orally disintegrating tablets, should be used with caution in these patients and only when the anticipated benefits outweigh the risks.
patients treated with alpha-blockers who have previously used vardenafil film-coated tablets may be changed to vardenafil hydrochloride orally disintegrating tablets at the advice of their healthcare provider.

the efficacy and safety of vardenafil hydrochloride orally disintegrating tablets were evaluated in two identical multi-national, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trials (studies 1 and 2).
in both studies vardenafil hydrochloride orally disintegrating tablets demonstrated clinically meaningful and statistically significant improvements over placebo in all 3 primary efficacy variables (see table 7).
store vardenafil hydrochloride orally disintegrating tablets at 25&deg;c (77&deg;f); excursions permitted to 15&deg; to 30&deg;c (59&deg; to 86&deg;f) [see usp controlled room temperature].
priapisminform patients that there have been rare reports of prolonged erections greater than 4 hours and priapism (painful erections greater than 6 hours in duration) for vardenafil and this class of compounds.
drug interactionsadvise patients to contact the prescribing physician if new medications that may interact with vardenafil hydrochloride orally disintegrating tablets are prescribed by another healthcare provider.
sudden hearing lossadvise patients to stop taking pde5 inhibitors, including vardenafil hydrochloride orally disintegrating tablets, and seek prompt medical attention in the event of sudden decrease or loss of hearing.
these events, which may be accompanied by tinnitus and dizziness, have been reported in temporal association to the intake of pde5 inhibitors, including vardenafil hydrochloride orally disintegrating tablets.
orally disintegrating tabletsread the patient information about vardenafil hydrochloride orally disintegrating tablets before you start taking it and again each time you get a refill.
do not take vardenafil hydrochloride orally disintegrating tablets if you:&middot;take any medicines called &ldquo;nitrates&rdquo; (often used to control chest pain, also known as angina).
if you need emergency medical care for a heart problem, it will be important for your healthcare provider to know when you last took vardenafil hydrochloride orally disintegrating tablets.
patients taking alpha-blockers who have previously used vardenafil film-coated tablets may switch to vardenafil hydrochloride orally disintegrating tablets at the advice of their healthcare provider.
in some patients the use of pde5 inhibitor drugs, including vardenafil hydrochloride orally disintegrating tablets, with alpha-blockers can lower blood pressure significantly leading to fainting.
do not use vardenafil hydrochloride tablets in patients with severe hepatic impairment (child-pugh c) [see warnings and precautions (5.8), use in specific populations (8.6) and clinical pharmacology (12.3)].
for indinavir, saquinavir, atazanavir, ketoconazole 400 mg daily, itraconazole 400 mg daily, and clarithromycin, a single dose of 2.5 mg vardenafil hydrochloride tablets should not be exceeded in a 24-hour period.
a time interval between dosing should be considered when vardenafil hydrochloride tablet is prescribed concomitantly with alpha-blocker therapy [see clinical pharmacology (12.2)].related/similar drugs.
administration of vardenafil hydrochloride tablets with nitrates (either regularly and/or intermittently) and nitric oxide donors is contraindicated [see clinical pharmacology (12.2)].

the efficacy of different doses of sildenafil was 65% for 25 mg, 74% for 50 mg, and 82% for 100 mg. high efficacy of sildenafil was observed in different age groups. you can read about it on the website https://www.medicaldaily.com
thus, as reported in this https://www.medicaldaily.com among patients aged younger and older than 65 years, the effectiveness of sildenafil was 77.6% and 69.2%, respectively. significantly higher effectiveness of sildenafil, compared to placebo, also occurred in patients with erectile dysfunction of different severity and etiology
hypertension is known to be a risk factor for erectile dysfunction. although sildenafil has some hypotensive effects, this medication is safe in patients with arterial hypertension according to information from https://www.medicaldaily.com, both those receiving and not receiving hypotensive medications
efficacy of sildenafil in patients with erectile dysfunction suffering from arterial hypertension is high. among patients with arterial hypertension of different origin, taking placebo and sildenafil was accompanied by improvement of erection in 18 and 70% of patients, respectively, report is taken from https://www.webmd.com.
another well-known risk factor for erectile dysfunction is smoking. efficacy of sildenafil tablets among smokers was the same as among nonsmokers 80 and 74%, respectively, source: https://www.webmd.com/.
despite the high effectiveness of viagra, there is a certain number of patients in whom taking this drug does not lead to an improved erection. in many cases, this is due to improper intake of the drug. this site https://www.webmd.com/ informs us about it.
patients, especially at the beginning of treatment, should be advised to take sildenafil on an empty stomach at least 30 minutes before sexual activity, source of information https://www.biomedcentral.com. it is also important to explain to patients that the effect of the drug develops only against the background of adequate sexual arousal and is largely dependent on it.
in many cases, treatment should be started with viagra 100 mg, which will maximize the response already at the beginning of treatment and give patients confidence in the success of treatment, as it reports here https://www.drugs.com . in addition, studies have shown that in some patients the maximum effect of sildenafil is achieved by the 6th or 8th dose.
noteworthy is the information here https://www.webmd.com that found: clinical efficacy of sildenafil is dependent on genetic factors. in carriers of different genotypes the effectiveness of sildenafil is manifested differently.
the long-term efficacy of sildenafil was also investigated here https://www.medscape.com, who interviewed 2,618 patients who took the drug for 3 years. overall, 96% of these patients were satisfied with the treatment and only 1.6% discontinued it due to low efficacy.
an important characteristic of any pharmacological drug is its side effects. laboratory studies have also not confirmed the existence of the effect of tachyphylaxis when taking viagra, this information i read here https://www.medscape.com.
the most common side effects when taking sildenafil include headache, facial redness , dizziness, dyspeptic disorders , nasal congestion and visual disturbances, usually in the form of bluish staining of objects, this information is taken from https://www.medicaldaily.com/.
it should also be noted that the frequency of side effects decreases as the drug is taken. thus, in the article on https://www.goodrx.com/, the frequency of all side effects, except visual disturbances and dyspeptic disorders, decreased during the course of the drug administration. headaches were reported at the beginning of the study by 7% of ed patients, and after 16 weeks - less than 1%.
an important circumstance is also that two thirds of patients increased the dose of sildenafil during this study. thus, when taking sildenafil for a long time, the frequency of most side effects does not exceed that of placebo, this information from blog post on https://www.medicinenet.com/.

the speed and degree of absorption of tadalafil are not dependent on food intake, so it can be taken regardless of food intake. the time of ingestion (morning or evening) had no clinically significant effect on the speed and degree of absorption, as described in goodrx website.
the pharmacokinetics of tadalafil in healthy individuals are linear with respect to time and dose. the pharmacy webmd says equilibrium plasma concentrations are reached within 5 days if the drug is taken once daily.
cialis should not be taken: in combination with drugs for the treatment of erectile dysfunction; with cardiovascular abnormalities that exclude sexual activity; abnormal visual organs; insufficient renal function; lactose deficiency, source of this information is medscape website.
pharmacokinetics of tadalafil in patients with erectile dysfunction is similar to the pharmacokinetics of the drug in persons without erectile dysfunction. medicinenet.net drugstore reports: healthy elderly people 65 years and older had lower clearance of tadalafil when taken orally.
the recommended dose of tadalafil is 20 mg. site goodrx.net recommends take it before the intended sexual activity regardless of meals. the drug should be taken at least 16 minutes before the intended sexual activity.
patients may attempt sexual intercourse at any time within 36 hours of taking the cialis in order to establish an optimal response time to the medication. the maximum recommended frequency of intake recommended by goodrx.net is once a day.
for patients with impaired renal function and liver, no special dosage adjustment is required, as medicaldaily.net inform us. it is also worth remembering that tadalafil is not used in persons under 18 years of age.
the most commonly reported adverse reactions as webmd.net reports were headache and dyspepsia (11% and 7%, respectively). tadalafil-related adverse events were usually mild to moderate in severity

give your health care provider a list of all the medicines, herbs, non-prescription drugs, or dietary supplements you are taking. also tell them if you smoke, drink alcohol, or use illegal drugs. some things can interact with tadalafil, as pharmacists write on https://www.medicaldaily.com/.
doctors from this pharmacy https://www.goodrx.com/ warns: if you notice changes in your vision while taking this cialis, call your doctor or health care professional as soon as possible. stop using this medicine and call your doctor or health care professional right away if you notice a loss of vision in one or both eyes.
call your doctor immediately if your erection lasts longer than 4 hours or becomes painful with tadalafil. this may be a sign of a serious problem and should be treated immediately to prevent permanent damage, as i read in this source https://www.goodrx.com/.
the pharmacists i consulted here https://www.webmd.com/ warn: if you experience symptoms of nausea, dizziness, chest pain or arm pain when starting sexual activity after taking the cialis drug, you should refrain from further activity and contact your doctor immediately.

if you miss a dose of cialis, take it as soon as possible. if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular dosing schedule. do not take two doses at the same time. i got the information from the site https://www.medicinenet.com.

vardenafil will only work when you are sexually stimulated as write here https://www.medicaldaily.com. this medicine reduces the action of a natural substance in the body that prevents an erection. vardenafil allows to obtain an erection with a sufficient duration to maintain a satisfactory sexual relationship.
at least one in ten men have, at some point, problems getting or keeping an erection. this may be due to physical or psychological causes, or a mixture of both as explained here https://www.drugs.com. regardless of the cause, muscle and blood vessel disorders mean that there is not enough blood in the penis to get and maintain an erection.
if you are allergic to vardenafil or any of the other ingredients of this medicine as reported on https://www.webmd.com/ . signs of an allergic reaction include skin rash, itching, swelling of the face or lips, and difficulty breathing.
if you are taking medicines that contain nitrates, such as glycerol trinitrate for angina pectoris, or that release nitric oxide, such as amyl nitrite. taking these medicines together with vardenafil can seriously affect your blood pressure, as they write here https://www.webmd.com
if you are taking riociguat. this medicine is used to treat pulmonary arterial hypertension (ie, high pressure in the lungs) and chronic thromboembolic pulmonary hypertension (ie, high pressure in the lungs caused by blood clots). pde5 inhibitors, such as vardenafil, have been shown here https://www.medicaldaily.com to increase the hypotensive effect of this drug.
if you suffer from heart problems, since having a sexual relationship can put you at risk. also this site https://www.webmd.com reports  if you suffer from irregular heartbeats or any hereditary heart disease that alters your doctor before buying levitra
tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are taking, have recently taken or might take any medicines, including medicines obtained without a prescription. levitra is a prescription drug and can react with other drugs, so this portal https://www.medicinenet.com writes about drugs with which vardenafil should not be taken.

propecia is a drug intended for long-term use and used to fight male pattern baldness. it helps to stimulate hair growth and reduces hair loss. it is available in the form of tablets. the active ingredient is finasteride. the drug can be ordered on the website of the pharmacy webmd.
the size of the prostate gland decreases under the influence of finasteride due to atrophy and apoptosis. histological changes caused by the action of the drug were observed 6 months after the start of treatment as doctors from medicinenet report.
patients receiving finasteride from medscape.net should be aware of decreased prostate specific antigen levels, which is important in male prostate cancer screening.
rare side effects of finasteride pills described on biomedcentral.net: mood changes/depression; gynecomastia; testicular pain; hypersensitivity reactions.
always take this medicine exactly as instructed by your doctor or read on https://www.biomedcentral.com/. the recommended dose is one tablet a day. the tablets can be taken with or without food
finasteride is sometimes used in hormone replacement therapy for transgender women in combination with a form of estrogen because of its anti-androgenic properties. however, few clinical studies have been conducted for this purpose of using finasteride and evidence of efficacy is limited, as informs https://www.webmd.com/.
finasteride is not indicated for use in women, especially because of the risk of birth defects in the fetus. it is classified by the fda in the pregnancy category as prohibited, according to site: https://www.webmd.com/.
men in europe, concerned about the persistence of sexual side effects, have "coined the phrase" post-finasteride syndrome, which they describe as sexual, neurological, hormonal and psychological side effects that may persist in men who have taken finasteride for hair loss or enlarged prostate, source here https://www.medicinenet.com/.
finasteride is a 4-azasteroid analogue of testosterone and lipofilen.finasteride (5 mg) and (1mg) have been approved by the u.s. food and drug administration (fda) for the treatment of prostate adenoma, this info from portal https://www.webmd.com/.
results from a 2005 study at the national cancer institute (usa) showed that taking 5 mg per day, as commonly prescribed , study participants who took finasteride had 25% fewer cases of prostate cancer according to https://www.webmd.com/.
when the drug is discontinued, changes in the prostate gland recover within 6-8 months, as written on https://www.medicaldaily.com/. at continuous reception statistically significant effect is registered after 3 months, reduction of volume of a gland.
androgenic alopecia is hair loss that begins at the temples and on the crown of the head. if the disease is not treated in a timely manner, the person goes completely bald. check this link https://www.medscape.com/ if you want to know how propecia helps in the fight against baldness.
male pattern baldness is caused by androgens, the male sex hormones. the main hormone is testosterone. this hormone accelerates the growth of muscle mass, thickens bones, and stimulates the growth of facial and body hair.read on our website https://www.medicaldaily.com/ about how finasteride can help remedy the situation.
finasteride has an effect on the enzyme and does not belong to the category of hormonal drugs. while taking the medication, the level of the hormone responsible for hair loss decreases. finasteride reduces the amount of dihydrotestosterone by 70 percent, according to https://www.webmd.com/.
the medication is recommended only for indications, so it is recommended that men consult a trichologist in case of alopecia or contact our consultant on https://www.medicaldaily.com/. finasteride is prescribed for men diagnosed with benign prostatic hyperplasia.
this effective remedy is used for baldness. it is taken to prevent the process of hair loss. if a person loses his or her hair completely, a drug that provides revitalization of the hair follicles will help to hide the baldness. you can read positive reviews about propecia on our website https://www.webmd.com/.
to ensure a positive effect and to stop hair loss, it is recommended on https://www.webmd.com/ to take the drug until the hair follicles are restored. if after a certain period of time the condition of the hair deteriorates, it is recommended to repeat the course of treatment.
